title: Trend Micro Deep Security Out-Of-Bounds Read Information Disclosure Vulnerability
description:
This vulnerability allows local attackers to disclose sensitive information on affected installations of Trend Micro Deep Security. An attacker must first obtain the ability to execute low-privileged code on the target system in order to exploit this vulnerability.
The specific flaw exists within the User Mode Hooking Monitor Engine. The issue results from the lack of proper validation of user-supplied data, which can result in a read past the end of an allocated buffer. An attacker can leverage this in conjunction with other vulnerabilities to escalate privileges and execute arbitrary code in the context of SYSTEM.
addtionnal_details: Trend Micro has issued an update to correct this vulnerability. More details can be found at:https://success.trendmicro.com/solution/000291590
timeline:
2022-02-16 - Vulnerability reported to vendor
2022-09-23 - Coordinated public release of advisory
credit: Michael DePlante (@izobashi) of Trend Micro's Zero Day Initiative
